Check Point vSEC integration with VMware NSX enables complementary, advanced security capabilities in the SDDC.  NSX DFW provides basic L2-L4 distributed firewall services while the Check Point vSEC integration enables micro-segmentation and advanced security services (L5-L7 support) including: IPS, Application Control and URL Filtering, Identity Awareness, Anti-Virus, Anti-Bot, and Threat Emulation. Additionally, Check Point Security Management enables seamlessly management of Check Point physical gateways and virtual appliances.

Virtual Volumes, is VMware’s new storage paradigm to facilitate per VM/VMDK data services on the storage array. This allows the storage to move away from a LUN centric storage representation to a granular form of representation. This is facilitated by the VMDK being stored natively on the storage array, which are referred to as Virtual Volumes (VVols). The storage array is made to be aware of the volumes and its association with the relevant VMs, through a special set of APIs, called vSphere APIs for Storage Awareness (VASA). Using these APIs, vSphere and the underlying storage array establish a two way communication for offloading certain services.   This HOL gives you a closer look at Virutual Volumes so you can get familiar with the concepts and some of the data path workflows.

HOL-1703-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module, we will walk through the installation of NSX from the initial deployment of the NSX Manager .ova file all the way through to deploying controllers, creating VTEP's and finally creating a Transport Zone. This is a walk-through and will make no changes to the actual lab.

Overview on Logical Switching In this lab you will first explore the key components of VMware NSX. The following other key aspects are covered in this module: 1) The addition of the NSX controller cluster has eliminated the requirement for multicast protocol support on the physical fabric. The controller cluster provides, among other functions, VTEP, IP and MAC resolution. 2) You will create a Logical Switch and then attach two VM's to the Logical Switch that you created. 3) Then demonstrate how the logical switch can span across L3 Physical Networks, and still have L2 connectivity between the two Web Servers. 4) Lastly, we will review the scalability and high availability of the NSX platform.

In the previous module you saw that users can create isolated logical switches/networks with few clicks. To provide communication across these isolated logical layer 2 networks, routing support is essential. In the NSX platform the distributed logical router allows you to route traffic between logical switches. One of the key differentiating feature of this logical router is that the routing capability is distributed in the hypervisor. By incorporating�this logical routing component users can reproduce complex routing topologies in the logical space. For example, in a three tier application connected to three logical switches, the routing between the tiers is handled by this distributed logical router. In this module you will demonstrate the following 1) How traffic flows when the routing is handled by an external physical router or NSX edge services gateway.  2) Then we will go through the configuration of the Logical Interfaces (LIFs) on the Logical router and enable routing between the App and DB tiers of the Application 3) Later we will configure dynamic routing protocols across the distributed logical router and the NSX Edge services gateway. We will show how internal route advertisements to the external router are controlled. 4) Finally you will see how various routing protocols, such as ECMP, can be used to scale and protect the Edge service gateway. This module will help you understand some of the routing capabilities supported in NSX platform and also how to utilize these capabilities while deploying a three tier application.

NSX provides in-kernel software L2 Bridging capabilities, that allow organizations to seamlessly connect traditional workloads and legacy VLANs to virtualized networks. L2 Bridging is widely used in brownfield environments to simplify the introduction of logical networks, as well as other scenarios that involve physical systems that require L2 connectivity to virtual machines. This module will guide you through the configuration of a L2 Bridging instance between a traditional VLAN and a NSX Logical Switch. In NSX-V 6.2 this function has been enhanced, by allowing bridged Logical Switches to be connected to Distributed Logical Routers. This operation was not permitted in previous versions of NSX.

HOL-1703-USE-2.Module Description: Micro-segmentation is powered by the Distributed Firewall (DFW) component of NSX. DFW operates at the ESXi hypervisor kernel layer and processes packets at near line-rate speed. Each VM has its own firewall rules and context. Workload mobility (vMotion) is fully supported with DFW, and active connections remain intact during the move. This advance security capability makes the data center network more secure by isolating each related group of virtual machines onto a distinct logical network segment, allowing the administrator to firewall traffic traveling from one segment of the data center to another (east-west traffic). This limits attackers� ability to move laterally in the data center.  Service Composer offers a canvas view displaying all security groups within the selected NSX Manager. The view also displays details such as members of each security group as well as the security policy applied on it.  This topic also introduces Service Composer by walking you through a partially configured system so that you can visualize the mappings between security groups and security policy objects at a high level from the canvas view.

This module will walk through the collapse of an application from a 3-tier network architecture into a single flat network.  This will enable the next module to show how to use NSX micro-segmentation to logically group virtual machines, and then provide firewall inspection at the vNIC independent of IP subnet.

HOL-1704-SDC-1.Module Description: The latency sensitivity feature is intended for specialized use cases that require extremely low latency. It is extremely important to determine whether or not your workload could benefit from this feature before enabling it. In a nutshell, latency sensitivity provides extremely low network latency with a tradeoff of increased CPU and memory cost as a result of less resource sharing, and increased power consumption.
HOL-1704-SDC-1.Module Title: CPU Performance Feature: Latency Sensitivity Setting

Optimize your environment for either balancing power and performance (recommended for most environments), or optimizing for maximum performance (which can sacrifice some power savings).

VMware vSphere� Fault Tolerance (FT) provides continuous availability for applications in the event of server failures by creating a live "shadow instance" of a virtual machine that is always up-to-date with the primary virtual machine. In the event of a hardware outage, vSphere FT automatically triggers failover�ensuring zero downtime and preventing data loss.  To see how FT works from a "functional" perspective, we will demonstrate it in our lab environment.

Combine Site Recovery Manager operations with the automated operations that other vRealize Orchestrator plug-ins provide.
HOL-1705-SDC-1.Module Title: Automating Site Recovery Manager tasks with vRealize Orchestrator

HOL-1705-SDC-1.Module Description: Learn how Site Recovery Manager, NSX, and stretched storage combine to give you a powerful solution to protect your critical workloads.
HOL-1705-SDC-1.Module Title: Storage Policy Based Protection Groups and SRM integration with NSX and Stretched Storage

HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Description: Learn to quickly and better understand information accessible through vRealize Automation and vRealize Operations. An overview of configuration, dashboards, metrics, badges, and management packs (MPs) are also provided.
HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Title: Integrate vRealize Automation with vRealize Operations

HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Description: This module walks us through content pack configuration in vRealize Log Insight, along with primary use cases such as Consumption, Operations, and Monitoring. We will see how vRealize Operations and vRealize Log Insight work together with queries and data.
HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Title: Integrate vRealize Log Insight with vRealize Operations

HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Description: This module will take you through the integration between vRealize Business and vRealize Automation and show you how to include cost information on blueprints and machines.
HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Title: Integrating vRealize Business with vRealize Automation

HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Description: This module will walk you through integrating NSX with vRealize Automation including creating a blueprint with NSX networking features.
This module will introduction you to vRealize Code Stream, and then walk you through installation and configuration.
HOL-1706-SDC-1.Module Title: Install and Configure vRealize Code Stream

HOL-1706-SDC-3.Module Description: From the Department of Defense to Financial Entities, the use of DISA Compliance standards is used across a broad set of industrities. This lab will show vSphere administrators how to deploy the ESXi VIBS to ensure there ESXi hosts are in compliance with DISA standards.
HOL-1706-SDC-3.Module Title: Deploying The DISA STIG For ESXi Compliance

HOL-1706-SDC-3.Module Description: Have you ever hired a contract or temporary worker who has not yet passed your security process? How fantastic would it be to limit and govern the type of day two actions they perform on a virtual machine! In this module we will show cloud administrators, how they can leverage approvals in vRealize Automation, to limit day two actions for virtual machines users in vRA.

16 characters, dont use *, at least a number and a special character, but never $. Do these security compliance requirments drive you to drink? If so, this lab is for you! In this lab we will run a PowerCLI script that sets the password complexity rules for ESXi user across every host in your cluster.
HOL-1706-SDC-3.Module Title: Automating Password Complexity for ESXi Users

HOL-1706-SDC-3.Module Description: In prior versions of vSphere, the audit logs on vSphere hosts did not do a good job of identifying what user made a change. The change was recoreded in vCenter, however ESXi logs would show vxpauser as the culprit. Leveraging vSphere 6 detailed logging capabilites and LogInsight, we will show administrators how to audit, who did what, on a paticular ESXi host.
HOL-1706-SDC-3.Module Title: Forensic Security with vRealize Log Insight

HOL-1706-SDC-5.Module Description: Using an offline demo, you will see how VMware Cloud Foundation significantly reduces the time required to configure an SDDC stack. The wizard-driven process gathers configuration data  and automatically configures the entire stack based on this input.
Using an HOL Interactive Simulation, you will see better understand the management and monitoring functionality of the EVO SDDC Manager.
This Interactive Simulation will step through the process to create a new VMware Horizon View infrastructure with EVO SDDC Manager.
HOL-1706-SDC-5.Module Title: Creating a VDI Workload Domain with VMware Cloud Foundation

HOL-1706-SDC-5.Module Description: This Interactive Simulation will explore deploying, expanding, and deleting a workload domain.
HOL-1706-SDC-5.Module Title: Creating an IaaS Deployment Workload Domain with VMware Cloud Foundation

HOL-1706-SDC-6.Module Title: VMware Validated Design for SDDC - Core Platform
VMware Validated Design for SDDC - Software-Defined Storage
VMware Validated Design for SDDC - Software-Defined Networking
VMware Validated Design for SDDC - Cloud Operations with vRealize Operations
VMware Validated Design for SDDC - Cloud Operations with vRealize Log Insight
VMware Validated Design for SDDC - Cloud Management and Automation with vRealize Automation

HOL-1706-USE-4.Module Description: This module will show how vRealize Operations Policies can be crafted to meet the required operational imperatives.  We will look at how they affect Capacity Analysis as well as other features such as Badge Status and the definition of waste such as Idle and Over Sized Virtual Machines.

In this module, we will first look at what Super Metrics are and how they can be readily constructed.  We will then look at how you can buid out some Custom Dashboards to take advantage of the Super Metris you have built.
HOL-1706-USE-4.Module Title: Creating Custom Dashboards with Super Metrics

HOL-1706-USE-4.Module Description: In this second module looking at how you can build Custom Dashboards we will look at how you can use End Point Operations to look more deeply at the OSs and Applications running in your guest Virtual Machines.  We will then look at how you can create Custom Dashboards that provide an OS and Application centric view of your environment.
HOL-1706-USE-4.Module Title: Creating Custom Dashboards with End Point Operations

HOL-1706-USE-4.Module Description: In this module, we will look at how you can take advantage of the Alerting Framework in vRealize Operations.  We will look at how you can create your own Alert Definitions built out of custom Symptoms, Recommendations and Actions.  Finally we will look at how some remediation tasks can be automated.
HOL-1706-USE-4.Module Title: Using the Alerting Framework - Symptoms, Recommendations, Actions and Automation

HOL-1706-USE-4.Module Description: In this module, we will look at how you can create custom Views and Reports from the rich set of Metrics and Properties collected by vRealize Operations.  We will also look at how the creation and circulation of reports can be automated.
In this final module, we will look at how we can use the vRealize Operations API and some of the other custom inegration capabilities.

HOL-1706-USE-7.Module Title: VMware Adapter for SAP LVM: Mass Operations
VMware Adapter for SAP LVM: Application Migration
VMware Adapter for SAP LVM: Provisioning

HOL-1708-CHG-3.Module Description: Virtual SAN�s Health UI provides insight into the health of your storage and VM performance � learn how to discover and resolve performance & availability issues.
Accept the challenge of resolving unknown VSAN failures injected into the lab to demonstrate your troubleshooting skills.
Use your VSAN skills to create & optimize a Metro-cluster using stretch-cluster features of VSAN.

HOL-1708-SDC-1.Module Description: Virtual SAN is radically simple, software-defined storage.  See how VSAN enables cluster-wide shared storage with just a few clicks of your mouse!
Learn how VSAN�s All-Flash option improves performance & how data compression, deduplication and new RAID settings yield 10x greater storage efficiency.
Use Virtual SAN�s Stretched Cluster option to avoid downtime for your VMs - optimize vSphere HA & VSAN to protect your VMs during site outages.
Explore how easy it is to enable VSAN�s Performance Service & use it to analyze VSAN performance and troubleshoot your VMs.
Explore how to automate VSAN configuration & policies using VMware PowerCLI.

HOL-1708-SDC-2.Module Description: Simplicity: Explore how Virtual Volumes integrate with vSphere & vCenter for vm-centric storage that avoids the complexity of legacy LUNs & files systems.
Learn how Virtual Volumes are created in 3rd-party storage arrays and presented & consumed in vCenter to enable storage operations with VM granularity.
Explore how Virtual Volumes streamline VM operations by making the VM's disk the primary unit of data management and optimizing IO and array services around the VM.
Explore the end-to-end process of creating and consuming new storage capacity & capabilities using 3rd-party array and Virtual Volumes.
Explore how to create storage policies for VMs stored on that ensure the performace & availability of your applications.

HOL-1710-SDC-1.Module Description: This module will provide a basic overview of virtualization and its core concepts.

This module will cover deployment models, management, and availability of the vCenter Server Appliance and the Platform Services Controller.  In this lab we'll also discuss the interoperability between the vCenter Server Appliance and vSphere Update Manager.
HOL-1710-SDC-1.Module Title: vCenter Server Appliance as a First Choice

HOL-1710-SDC-1.Module Description: This module will cover the next generation of HTML5-based management clients. First we�ll discuss the VMware Host Client which enables vSphere Administrators to manage their ESXi hosts through an HTML5 web interface. Then we�ll cover the enhancements made to the current vSphere Web Client as well as introduce the next generation of vSphere Client using HTML5.
vRealize Operations provides vSphere Administrators visibility into their vSphere environment's health. This module will cover how to navigate the Product UI and utilize reports and dashboards.

vRealize Log Insight is a sophisticated and scalable log analytics and log management platform. This module will provide an overview and walkthough of several of the capabilities vRealize Log Insight has to offer.
This module will cover basic administration of a vSphere environment.  Topics will include management of vSphere clusters, virtual machines, ESXi hosts, storage, and networking.

HOL-1710-SDC-3.Module Description: The latest version of vSphere includes many enhancements to mature features such as vMotion while also including several new features that continue to make vSphere stand apart from the competition. This module will describe these improvements and how they'll deliver value to VMware customers.

vCenter Server and the Platform Services Controller work hand in hand. In this module you'll learn about the recommended deployment models for these two critical vSphere components and their impacts to vSphere design. Single site, multi-site, and highly available topologies will also be discussed.
HOL-1710-SDC-3.Module Title: vCenter Server and Platform Services Controller Architecture

HOL-1710-SDC-3.Module Description: Storage in vSphere isn't just limited to VMFS and NFS. Learn how new software defined storage technologies such as Virtual SAN and Virtual Volumes deliver storage policy based management of virtual machines as well as streamline storage management.

VMware vSphere networking can be simple to deploy and manage. There are also advanced capabilities that enable the flexibility and performance that some customers require. In this module learn about both the vSphere Standard Switch and the vSphere Distributed Switch and what features each provide to a vSphere environment.

This module will explore some of the more advanced topics of vRealize Opertaions that enable vSphere Administrators to further optimize their vSphere environment. Some of the features you'll learn about in this module include custom profiles, workload placement, custom data centers, and the automated action framework.

vRealize Log Insight is a power log management and analytics platform that extends beyond vCenter. This module will provide an overview of some of the advanced capabilities of vRealize Log Insight and how to provide the same log analysis for other parts of the data center.

HOL-1710-SDC-5.Module Description: This module shows the simplicity and ease of use in managing VMs with the vSphere Automation API and Multi-Platform CLI.
This module explores the tight integration between the new vSphere Automation SDK for Python and Pyvmomi to perform common vSphere tasks in Python.
This module explores the integration of Java with the vSphere APIs to perform a set of vSphere tasks.

HOL-1710-USE-2.Module Description: This module will look at the steps to deploy and configure vRealize Operations which will allow vSphere Administrators to effectively monitor their vSphere environment.
HOL-1710-USE-2.Module Title: vSphere with Operations Management Installation & Deployment

HOL-1710-USE-2.Module Description: vSphere provides many options for upgrading your deployment. For a successful vSphere upgrade, you must understand the upgrade options, the configuration details that impact the upgrade process, and the sequence of tasks.  This module will discuss how to upgrade vCenter Server to the latest version using the standard upgrade workflows.

This module will explore migrating from vCenter Server running on Windows to the vCenter Server Appliance. Migrating to the vCenter Server Appliance decreases complexity, simplifies management, and removed the need for an external database for vCenter Server.

In this module vSphere Administrators will learn how to deploy and configure a vSphere environment for high availability including vCenter Server, the Platform Services Controller, and virtual machines. You'll also explore how vSphere is also resilient during network failures and follow a Business Continuity demonstration using vSphere Replication and vSphere Data Protection.

In this module you'll learn how to optimize the performance and utilization of a vSphere environment by using features such as Storage DRS, Workload Placement, and Storage Policy Based Management. You'll also look at right-sizing virtual machines in order to reclaim wasted resources and increase workload density.
We will review the Log Insight from installation to intergrating with vRealize Operations Manager and vCenter.

HOL-1710-USE-4.Module Description: PowerCLI is a powerful tool for vSphere Administrators. This module will demonstrate how PowerCLI can be used with vRealize Operations to automate reporting.
HOL-1710-USE-4.Module Title: Administering vSphere with Operations Management with PowerCLI

HOL-1710-USE-4.Module Description: Introduced in vSphere 6.0, cross vCenter vMotion has created many new possibilities for workload mobility. In this module you'll learn about the requirements for cross vCenter vMotion and use it to migrate a virtual machine between two vCenter Servers.

VMware continues to deliver new capabilities for mature technologies such as Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS). In this module we'll look at new DRS capabilities that will proactively maintain a well balanced vSphere environment.
HOL-1710-USE-4.Module Title: What's New with the Distributed Resource Scheduler

HOL-1710-USE-4.Module Description: Content Library is another feature introduced in vSphere 6.0. In this module you'll learn how to leverage Content Library to centrally manage vApps, VM templates, cd images, and scripts. You'll also learn about some of the new capabilities for Content Library in the latest version of vSphere.

vSphere Distributed Swtiches add advanced networking capabilties and reduce deployment time for ESXi hosts. In this module you'll learn how to leverage vSphere Distributed Switches to ensure a consistent network configuration across your hosts and clusters.

VMware vSphere provides many ways for virtual machines to consume storage. In this module learn to provision and manage datastores for virtual machines. You'll also learn how Software Defined Storage concepts, including Virtual SAN and Virtual Volumes, can simplify storage management and optimize consumption.
Explore the new Auto Deploy and Image Builder graphical user interface (GUI) and see how stateless compute infrastructure can save time deploying, patching, and upgrading hosts.

Lines of business can have unique requirements and service level agreements (SLAs) their applications along with stringent alerting to let them know when their applications are not performing optimally. In this module you'll learn how to configure custom alerts and enable controlled usage of resources based on business requirements to ensure SLAs are being met across the organization.

vRealize Log Insight delivers extensive analytics capabilities. In this module explore more advanced features of vRealize Log Insight in order to display complex datasets in simple, meaninful ways with Dashboards, decrease mean time to resolution with Queries, and increase visibility for problems and security with new integrations for vSphere Audit Logging.

HOL-1720-SDC-1.Module Description: This lab will explore VMware's Integrated OpenStack

In this part of the lab, we will explore using OpenStack and how it leverages the VIO plugin to deploy VMs. We will also introduce you to the OpenStack Horizon interface and OpenStack Administration and Configuration.
In this module we will be focusing on the VIO + NSXv networking model and it's subsequent features.
In this module, we focus on setting up Static Routing, Enabling/Disabling NAT and Distributed Routing.

This module covers the more advanced features of OpenStack. The Nova, Neutron and Cinder CLI clients will be used. We will be working with Glance image catalogs. We will also explore Heat templates for orchestrating OpenStack resources.
This module provides an overview of troubleshooting and management tools that are available for your VIO deployment.
HOL-1720-SDC-1.Module Title: Using VMware vRealize Solutions to Operationalize OpenStack

HOL-1721-SDC-5.Module Description: Explore the vRealize Orchestrator Client. Learn the basics of vRealize Orchestrator, such as parameters, attributes, schema design, presentation, workflow tokens, version history, and user permissions, followed by executing a basic workflow.
Learn how to build and run your first vRealize Orchestrator workflow using a Scripted Task.
Explore how to create and use vRealize Orchestrator Actions to bring exciting new capabilities to your workflows.
Explore configuration and resource elements. Then, test your knowedge of vRealize Orchestrator by creating a clone VM workflow leveraging those elements.
HOL-1721-SDC-5.Module Title: Putting it all Together: Creating a Clone VM Workflow

HOL-1721-SDC-5.Module Description: Learn how to properly implement error handling in vRealize Orchestrator workflows. Then, explore vRealize Orchestrator packages and how to create, import and export them.
Learn how vRealize Orchestrator Plug-Ins can extend vRealize Orchestrator even further. Install a Plug-In and finally create a workflow using the HTTP-REST Plug-In.

HOL-1721-SDC-6.Module Description: By exploring the basics of PowerCLI, you will learn how to automate the configuration of ESXI hosts including joining an Active Directory domain, listing available objects, creating datastores and much more.
HOL-1721-SDC-6.Module Title: Automate configuration activities for ESXI Hosts

HOL-1721-SDC-6.Module Description: Learn how to automate core vCenter administrative tasks, including creation of Datacenters, Clusters, Resource Pools, and manage permissions and much more using PowerCLI.
HOL-1721-SDC-6.Module Title: Automate configuration activities for vCenter Server

HOL-1721-SDC-6.Module Description: Explore the lifecycle and configuration management of virtual machines using PowerCLI. You will learn how to create a VM from a template, import an OVF, perform a hot add of virtual hardware and much more.

HOL-1721-USE-1.Module Description: Explore the benefits of vRealize Automation. Putting governance and policy based automation around your business processes can dramatically reduce IT delivery overhead and time to market. Learn how vRealize Automation can help transform your business.
HOL-1721-USE-1.Module Title: What can vRA 7 Do for You?

HOL-1721-USE-1.Module Description: Explore the basic administrative functions of vRealize Automation. You will learn how to create a tenant, build administrative user accounts, connect to a domain, and set up vSphere infrastructure for automation.
Design your first basic service in vRealize Automation to see how a Blueprint is built. You will then explore provisioning and lifecycle management of your newly created VM.
Learn how to use Entitlements to control access to Catalog Items. Then, use Approval Policies to configure business-aligned controls to add further governance.
HOL-1721-USE-1.Module Title: Policy Based Lifecycle Management and Governence

HOL-1721-USE-2.Module Description: Discover the power of vRealize Automation by deploying a Composite Blueprint which delivers a multi-tiered clustered application utilizing NSX  for load balancing, networking and security.

Explore the �better together� integration between vRealize Automation and NSX. Discover how to dynamically consume NSX services, including logical routers, firewalls and load balancers on the Blueprint Design Canvas.
Using the Blueprint Design Canvas, you will author and combine IaaS machine blueprints with Software components plus networking into complex applications.

Anything as a Services (XaaS) blueprints leverage vRealize Orchestrator to model advanced business processes and make them available via self-service Catalog, bringing the �art of the possible� to you.

Learn how XaaS can be used to present Puppet as part of a converged blueprint to install and configure software on a newly provisioned virtual machine and use Cloud Client to export and import blueprints.
HOL-1721-USE-2.Module Title: Advanced Content Authoring Using XaaS and Puppet

HOL-1721-USE-3.Module Description: Explore the limitless flexibility that extensibility brings to vRealize Automation, and learn about different ways you can implement and leverage it to streamline and automate complex processes.

Explore how the Event Broker enables unprecedented levels of flexibility in vRealize Automation. Learn how to  create an Event Subscription and extend the lifecycle of any workload to support complex business needs.
HOL-1721-USE-3.Module Title: Introduction to Lifecycle Extensibility with Event Broker

HOL-1721-USE-3.Module Description: Learn how to implement common use cases that the Event Broker enables, including custom host naming, CMDB/ITSM integration, and DNS record management.
HOL-1721-USE-3.Module Title: Using Event Broker for Extensibility Use Cases

HOL-1721-USE-3.Module Description: Learn how to use Event Broker to integrate the popular Infoblox IPAM solution with vRealize Automation. Enable flexible, robust and enterprise-ready IP address management using this commonly-requested combination.

HOL-1721-USE-4.Module Description: Explore how vRealize Code Stream leverages your existing software development lifecycle tools. Review how to implement application release automation for custom developed applications and IT infrastructure.

Create an application release pipeline with vRealize Code Stream, vRealize Automation, Jenkins and Artifactory. As a release manager, you will automate the build, test and deployment of a sample eCommerce application.
HOL-1721-USE-4.Module Title: Using vRealize Code Stream for Application Release Automation

HOL-1721-USE-4.Module Description: Walk through migrating vRealize Automation infrastructure constructs between tenants using the vRealize Code Stream Management Pack for IT DevOps (fomerly known as Houdini).
HOL-1721-USE-4.Module Title: vRealize Code Stream for IT DevOps

HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Description: This module provides an overview of the Palo Alto Networks VM-Series integration with VMware NSX and the configuration of dynamic security policies based on context from VMware NSX.
HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Title: Palo Alto Networks VM-Series and VMware NSX dynamic security policy configuration

HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module, VMware NSX and Palo Alto Networks VM-Series solution is deployed to secure a 3-tier application. This module covers creation of Security Group and traffic redirection using Service Composer. This module also shows you how to define dynamic security policies on Panorama based on context from VMware NSX.
HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Title: Configuring Palo Alto Networks VM-Series with VMware NSX to protect a multi-tier application

HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module VMware NSX DFW is configured to secure intra-tier traffic between web front-end servers . This module shows you how to define dynamic Security Groups (based on VM name and based on Logical Switch) and then how to use them in DFW policy configuration.
HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Title: Using Distributed FireWall (DFW) to Protect Intra-tier Traffic

HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module, the Palo Alto Networks VM-Series firewalls are configured with advanced vulnerability protections to prevent against code injection technique (SQL injection) or brute-force attack. Using the virtual firewalls, the student will create security profile and attach it to security policy, then simulate some attacks and verify VM-Series successfully block them.
HOL-1723-SDC-1.Module Title: Using advanced Palo Alto Networks security policy to protect application tiers

HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module, you will learn about the capabilities delivered with Check Point vSEC integration with VMware NSX Manager and vCenter. You will be armed with new skills regarding the Check Point vSEC components and managing vSEC; where to look within NSX Manager to identify the vSEC integration components; and where traffic is redirected to vSEC.
HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Title: Check Point Introduction, Configuration, and Traffic Redirection

HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module, you will get hands-on working with dynamic security policy in the SDDC.  You will learn how VMware vCenter Data Center objects and NSX Security Groups are dynamically updated with the Check Point vSEC integration, and how easily these dynamic objects are utilized in the Check Point security policy.
HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Title: Dynamic Policy Application with vCenter and NSX Objects

HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module, you will learn how to solve the problem of protecting East-West traffic in the SDDC against lateral threats.
HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Title: Securing East-West Traffic in the SDDC with IPS

HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module, you will learn how to solve the problem of detecting, containing, and quarantining application VMs that have been bot compromised.
HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Title: Bot Detection, Quarantine, and Incident Reporting

HOL-1724-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module you will get a deeper dive into technical details regarding Check Point vSEC with VMware NSX integration.

HOL-1725-SDC-1.Module Description: In this module the NSX REST API is used to configure NSX components.  Using the REST API the students will configure Logical Switches, Distributed Routers, and other NSX features.
In this module students will review preconfigured multi-site NSX components.  This will include NSX Manager roles, Universal Controllers, Universal Transport Zones, and Universal Logical Switches.
In this module students will configure and verify Universal Distrubted Routing and Universal Distributed Firewall rules.
In this module students will configure egress optimization of network traffic and vMotion an application from one site to another.

HOL-1725-USE-2.Module Title: Review Pre-Configured Multi-Site NSX and Configure Site-Local Routing

HOL-1728-SDC-1.Module Description: Configure a newly deployed VxRail appliance.
Explore management features such as system health.
Become familiar with VxRail Manager monitoring and maintenance features.
Witness auto-discovery of a new VxRail node for scale-out.
HOL-1728-SDC-1.Module Title: Expanding and Extending VxRail in Your Datacenter

HOL-1730-USE-1.Module Description: Building application isolation with containers for consistent testing environments.  Drive to faster business agility
What are the advantages and disadvantages of using Docker containers in a corporate environment
Install and configure vSphere Integrated Containers into an existing vCenter environment
Developers get what they want, while operations get what they know.
HOL-1730-USE-1.Module Title: vSphere Integrated Containers: Best of Both Worlds

HOL-1730-USE-1.Module Description: How would a developer build a containerized application within vCenter using vSphere Integrated Containers
HOL-1730-USE-1.Module Title: Building an application with vSphere Integrated Containers

HOL-1730-USE-2.Module Description: This module will introduce you to the new operational model for cloud native apps. �You will walk through the Photon Platform control plane management architecture and will get a guided introduction to image management, resource management and multi-tenancy. �You will use a combination of the Management Ui and CLI to become familiar with Photon Platform.

This module will engage you in the Cloud Native operational model by setting up the environment and deploying a container application through Photon Platform API. �You will learn how to define tenant resources, create images, flavors, vms, and networks. �You will also be introduced to persistent disks which are independent of your VM lifecycle and extend Docker volumes to multiple hosts. �You will use both the CLI and mgmt. UI in performing these tasks. � Finally, you will build an application with (nginx, redis, Node.js) to display a web page with port mapping to show some basic networking capabilities. �Basic troubleshooting through LogInsight will also be performed
HOL-1730-USE-2.Module Title: Cloud Admin Operations With Photon Platform - IaaS Deep Dive

HOL-1730-USE-2.Module Description: This module provides an introduction to the operational model for developers of cloud native applications. �Deploying containers at scale will not be done through individual Docker run commands (as seen in the previous module), but through the use of higher level frameworks that provide orchestration of the entire application. Orchestration could include application deployment, restart on failure, as well as up/downscaling of applications instances. In this module you will focus on container frameworks that manage micro service applications running on Photon Platform. �You will build and deploy a simple web application using Opensource Kubernetes and Docker. � You will also see how orchestration at scale can be administered through a tool like Rancher
HOL-1730-USE-2.Module Title: Container Orchestration Frameworks with Photon Platform

HOL-1741-USE-1.Module Description: In module one, we are going to discuss and demonstrate Just-In-Time application deployment. This will demonstrate the ability to provision applications in real time and how doing so is valuable to clinicians. The solution saves clinicians and end users time spent waiting for IT and adds time back to seeing patients.
In this lab, you will use Trend Micro Deep Security Agentless Anti Virus to detect a virus and have VMware NSX protect the Horizon infrastructure.
HOL-1741-USE-1.Module Title: Protecting Horizon Desktops with NSX and Trend Micro Deep Security

HOL-1741-USE-1.Module Description: In this module we will use the VMware NSX Load Balancer Feature with the Horizon Connection Servers to restrict access to internal users.
HOL-1741-USE-1.Module Title: Securing and protecting internal access using VMware NSX Load Balancing

HOL-1741-USE-1.Module Description: In this module we will securing external Horizon View access utilizing the new hardened access point appliance with VMware NSX Edge Gateway Services.
HOL-1741-USE-1.Module Title: Securing and protecting external access using VMware Horizon access servers

HOL-1741-USE-1.Module Description: In this module we are going to take a look at leveraging NSX with identity based firewalling to allow access to our PACS application. By utilizing NSX we have the ability to change the firewall policies in real time, this can be done at either the group or individual level with granularity as required. This flexibility allows healthcare IT departments to not only provide a more secure system but one that can be quickly adapted as requirements change.

HOL-1751-MBL-4.Module Title: VSAN and vRealize Operations for Horizon

HOL-1751-MBL-6.Module Title: Presenting a Linux Hosted Desktop with Horizon 7

HOL-1753-MBL-1.Module Description: This module will cover the installation and configuration of VMware Identity Manager (vIDM). �vIDM 2.6 appliance features include the portal (which users will see labeled as Workspace One), � AirWatch Directory integration, access policy integration, and Horizon True SSO support. �It provides a simple and secure enterprise platform that delivers and manages any app on any device by integrating, application and mobility management. In this module you will review the prerequisites and configure the vIDM appliance. Once the configuration is complete, you will take a tour of the interface and view what additional features and functionality are available.
HOL-1753-MBL-1.Module Title: Install and Configure VMware Identity Manager

HOL-1753-MBL-1.Module Description: VMware Identity Manager lets you build a self-service app store, so users can access virtually any application on any device from a single portal. This allows for better control for admins and better ease of use for the end-user. With support for Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiatives, Workspace ONE lets IT centrally deliver, manage and secure these assets across devices. It reduces employee on-boarding time, consolidates access to corporate resources for better intellectual property protection and reduces helpdesk calls. In this module you will learn how to integrate Horizon 7 with VMware Identity Manager to access hosted applications.

In this module you will learn how to configure a ThinApp repository in the VMware Identity Manager and entitle users/user groups to access applications. You will learn how to handle software updates for ThinApp packages presented via the VMware Identity Manager.

In this module you will learn how to configure Web and SaaS applications in VMware Identity Manager. With VMware Identity Manager, you can provide Single-Sign-On (SSO) for your users to any web application supporting Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML).

HOL-1753-MBL-1.Module Description: VMware Identity Manager allows for setting up Network Ranges and different authentication policies can be assigned to different network ranges.  For this lab we are using FreeRADIUS.net, in a real-world scenario this could be your RSA Server or any other 2-factor authentication solution supporting RADIUS protocol. We have setup a different password (123456) other than the default AD-password (VMware1!) typically used in the HOL, consider this your RSA token.

HOL-1753-MBL-2.Module Description: In this module you review some of the application challenges that exist in today's environment, and how some of them can be addressed with App Volumes. There will be no actions to be performed this chapter.

In this module we will be utilizing App Volumes to create an AppStack. �An AppStack is comprised of one or more applications that can be assigned to a user as a read-only disk. �A users can have one or many AppStacks assigned to them. � �In this module you will learn the steps involved in preparing for and creating a AppStack.
HOL-1753-MBL-2.Module Title: Capturing an Application with App Volumes

HOL-1753-MBL-2.Module Description: Leveraging AppVolumes, �IT has the ability to provide fast application delivery, with a straightforward packaging process. �With AppVolumes you can deploy AppStacks �to Horizon, Citrix XenApp, XenDesktop, and RDSH �virtual environment. The App Volumes agent is required to be installed on any Windows VM that the AppStack is being deployed to.

This lab is designed to introduce you to the integration of AirWatch and Cisco ISE.

Here's a high-level of what will be completed during the setup: Configure the iApp for View to support load balancing Horizon Clients across a pool of Connection Servers, Test and validate the Horizon Client connections and Test the failure of one server in the pool.

BIG-IP GTM and BIG-IP Local Traffic Manager (LTM) work together to ensure that requests are sent to a user's preferred data center, regardless of the user�s current location. This type of implmenetation is common when there are multiple Horizon instances distributed throughout two or more physical/logical data centers.    This section of the lab will demonstrate how to manage Horizon traffic across multiple data centers.
HOL-1759-USE-3.Module Title: Managing Horizon Traffic across Multiple Data Centers with BIG-IP

HOL-1759-USE-4.Module Description: In this module, we'll configure the BIG-IP to load balance authentication and authorization connections across a multiple AppVolumes Servers. HOL-1781-HBD-1.Module Description: VMware vCloud� Air is a public cloud service that enables you to quickly and securely take advantage of the benefits of the cloud while extending and maximizing the value of your existing on-premises IT investments. vCloud Air leverages the same tools, technologies and skills that you already have while delivering new cloud capabilities that allow your organization to drive business innovation. Learn about the consumption models, the architecture and features available in vCloud� Air.

HOL-1781-HBD-1.Module Description: This module is going to give you a tour of the user interface in vCloud Air. You will also be creating your first virtual machine in vCloud Air, as well as configuring network features such as NAT and firewall rules. Finally, you will be configuring backup and restore of your virtual machine.

VMware's vCloud Air Object Storage is a scalable, effcient, and cost-effective solution for unstructured data. As part of our commitment to deliver best-in-class performance, VMware is proud to deliver object storage solutions powered by Google Cloud Platform through vCloud Air. This module will give you a demonstration of Google Object Storage.

In this module, you will get an overview of Hybrid Cloud Manager (HCM).  Enable a true hybrid cloud experience with vCloud Air Hybrid Cloud Manager. vSphere users can set up and manage workloads in vCloud Air from within vSphere. Enabling this single pane of glass management capability gives the IT admins greater capabilities for managing all of their environments, whether On-premise or in vCloud Air.  Capabilities include visibility and control of vCloud Air environments, advanced networking connections that enable high-speed connections for true workload portability, and extends hybrid identity for improved user management. The vSphere Hybrid Cloud Manager brings your data center and vCloud Air into a single view.

HyTrust has worked closely with VMware and the vCloud Air team to develop encryption and key management software for vCloud Air. With HyTrust DataControl you can take advantage of the cost effective agility you get with the cloud while being confident that nobody can read your data because it is encrypted and you control the encryption keys. Best of all, it�s fast and easy to deploy and manage and the encryption travels with your VMs.

HOL-1782-HBD-1.Module Description: VMware vCloud� Air� Hybrid Cloud Manager� offers VMware vSphere� users a seamless option for extending their on-premises data center into vCloud Air. Customers can extend their environments to include vCloud Air with L2 VPN network extension. More importantly, customers  are able to take advantage of bi-directional workload portability, using replication-based, WAN accelerated application migration. These capabilities simplify workload management and enable users to extend their environments effectively for a true hybrid cloud experience.

VMware vCloud� Air� Advanced Networking Services offers a set of networking and security services that improves overall network manageability and accelerates application time-to-market by delivering an agile and cost-efficient platform for zero-trust security in the cloud. Built on VMware NSX�technology, these services offer customers a path towards true hybrid networking.  In this module we will review the following Advanced Networking Services and Edge Services features: � Overview of Advanced Network Services � Edge Firewall Services � Load Balancer � DHCP � NAT � SSL-VPN
HOL-1782-HBD-1.Module Title: Advanced Networking Services and Edge Services

HOL-1782-HBD-1.Module Description: Micro-Segmentation is implemented through distributed, stateful firewalls that protect VMs at the hypervisor level. With simple management from a single interface, stateful firewallss don�t slow down performance for latency-sensitive use cases like VOIP, for example. Micro-segmentation can cover not only individual VM�s but also multi-VM, multi Network Apps, and groups of objects.  With the Trust Groups, firewall rules can be applied not just to networks but also to objects such as applications. You can define a network or security policy and apply this policy to your VMs. In the example here,� App1�s Trust Group consists of a VM Web Server, VM Application Server and a VM Database Server.� The policy on App1 not only protects North-South network traffic to and from vCloud Air but also East-West traffic within the vCloud Air Production Network. Lastly, these Firewall rules can be copied and duplicated per application or object, making it easier to deploy new apps in the cloud.

Today, virtualized networking allows the physical network configurations to be replicated using software. Using an existing (and trusted) on-premise design as the blueprint, network architectures can be recreated for cloud use, including generating a Hybrid DMZ. Hybrid DMZ provides the same level of network and service aggregation as an on-premises DMZ .  In this module, we will see how we use BGP to configure a simulated Hybrid DMZ environment.

HOL-1783-HBD-1.Module Description: Use vRealize Automation to provision and manage to your vCloud Air Infrastructure. Use Policy and Governance to control who has access to provision to vCloud Air. Use vRealize Automation to provde Lifecycle management of your resources in vCloud Air

HOL-SDC-1634.Module Description: vRealize Operations Manager provides administrators with simple and powerful information they need to make sure virtual machines have the optimal amount of resources allocated.  A virtual machine may have been provisioned with far more resources than are required to support an application.  This leads to waste and inefficiencies that drive up costs and create artificial constraints on an otherwise well designed virtual infrastructure. On the other hand, virtual machines can also be unintentionally starved for resources due to under-sized allocation of resources.  In a highly efficient virtual infrastructure it is important to identify and correct these imbalances and tune virtual machine allocations to the level appropriate for each individual application. Fortunately, vRealize Operations Manager provides views and reports to help identify these imbalances and even makes recommendations on appropriate resource allocation.  This is known as Right-Sizing and this module will show you how.

HOL-SDC-1635.Module Description: vRealize Log Insight delivers real-time log management for VMware environments, with machine learning-based Intelligent Grouping, high performance search and better troubleshooting across physical, virtual, and cloud environments.
