HOL-HBD-1482.Module Description: In this module we will show you how IP space located within your data centers can be extended to vCloud Air.
HOL-HBD-1482.Module Title: IP Address Portability Between Customer and VMware vCloud® Air™ Data Centers (Data Center Extension)

HOL-HBD-1482.Module Description: Explore a use-case around a multi-tiered architecture that utilizes the isolation features of VMware vCloud Air, Firewall, IPsec VPN, and vCloud Air hosting
HOL-HBD-1482.Module Title: Public and Private Cloud Multi-Tiered Application Networking

HOL-HBD-1483.Module Description: Use vCloud Automation Center to offer vCloud Air from a Service Catalog to tenants in a self-service portal with automation and orchestration
HOL-HBD-1483.Module Title: Automate IT Service delivery on VMware vCloud® Air™ with vCloud Automation Center

HOL-HBD-1483.Module Description: Use the vCenter Operations Manager management pack for vCloud Air to monitor and manage your resources in vCloud Air.
HOL-HBD-1483.Module Title: Monitor resources on VMware vCloud® Air™ with vCenter Operations Manager

HOL-HBD-1483.Module Description: Use the vCloud Connector to migrate VMs, vAPPs and templates to and from vCloud Air
HOL-HBD-1483.Module Title: Migrate workloads to VMware vCloud® Air™ with vCloud Connector

HOL-HBD-1483.Module Description: Use PowerCLI to automate the management of resources in vCloud Air
HOL-HBD-1483.Module Title: Automate resource management in VMware vCloud® Air™ with PowerCLI

HOL-HBD-1484.Module Description: In this module the student will configure vCloud Connector and vSphere Replication in their private Datacenter to work with Disaster Recovery. They will then configure a VM in their cluster to replicate to vCloud Air.
HOL-HBD-1484.Module Title: Preparing for VMware vCloud® Air™ Disaster Recovery

HOL-HBD-1484.Module Description: In this module the student will perform a test failover of a VM to vCloud Air Disaster Recovery and verify functionality.
In this module the student will perform a planned failover of a VM to vCloud Air Disaster Recovery and then failback to their private data center.

HOL-HBD-1681.Module Description: This lab will provide you with the basic skills necessary to successfully navigate the vCloud Air User Interface (UI).
This lab will provide you with the basic skills necessary to successfully navigate the vCloud Air User Interface (UI).
HOL-HBD-1681.Module Title: Identifying and Deploying Workloads in vCloud Air

HOL-HBD-1681.Module Description: This module will introduce you to the vCloud Air Plug-in for the vSphere web client.
In this lab, you will be introduced to Gateways and Networks of the vCloud Air.

HOL-HBD-1682.Module Description: Use Hybrid Cloud Manager (HCM) to transfer a VM into vCloud Air. See what is possible for L2 VPN, SSL VLP, Silverpeak and latest web client plug-in
In this module with will configure DHCP, NAT, Routing and VPN
Use micro segmentation to isolate a WordPress and E-Commerce VM. Configure the Load Balancer

HOL-HBD-1683.Module Description: In this module, we will be demonstrating how to automatically provision new services from catalog to vCloud Air via vRealize Automation (vRA). At first, we will setup vRA to discover vCloud Air resources. Then, we will provision a service to vCloud Air and provide access to the user. Lastly, we will explore the different actions possible to operate that service.
HOL-HBD-1683.Module Title: Automate IT Service delivery on VMware vCloud Air with vRealize Automation

HOL-HBD-1683.Module Description: In this lab module you will see how you can monitor workloads not just in your local datacenter but also in vCloud Air using the VMware's vRealize Operations management platform. vRealize Operations automates operations management using predictive analytics and an integrated approach to performance, capacity, and configuration management. It enables IT organizations to get greater visibility and actionable intelligence to proactively ensure service levels, optimum resource usage, and configuration compliance in dynamic virtual and cloud environments. vRealize Operations can gather performance metrics and entity relationships from many different IT operations tools such as vCenter, EMC storage management tools, NetApp management tools, Microsoft SCOM, Oracle Enterprise Manager, etc via a Management Pack. A comprehensive list of available adapters and management packs can be found on VMware's Solution Exchange at http://solutionexchange.vmware.com.
HOL-HBD-1683.Module Title: Monitor resources in VMware vCloud Air with vRealize Operations

HOL-HBD-1683.Module Description: Most sysadmins are familiar with using PowerShell (and PowerCLI in VMware virtualized environments) to manage the lifecycle of servers and to automate day to day administration. This module will walk through how the new PowerCLI cmdlets for vCloud Air can be used to deploy and delete VMs, manage catalog items, report virtual datacenter statistics, upload OVF files, and configure networking.
HOL-HBD-1683.Module Title: Automate resource management in VMware vCloud Air with PowerCLI

HOL-HBD-1684.Module Description: In this module learn how VMware makes DR to the cloud easy. Learn about New Features and use cases
Startup the vSphere Replication appliance, replicate a new VM to vCloud Air, failover and do a reverse failback.
Learn how vRealize Orchestrator (vRO) can be used to automate  replicating VMs, failover and failback to create your own custom runbook

HOL-HBD-1685.Module Description: Describes how to log into the Admin UI and connect vCloud Director to VMware Learning Platform

Assume your organization's (Rainpole Company) cloud administrator has already configured your cloud resources so that you can use VMware Learning Platform. Such cloud resource configuration tasks are accomplished using VMware's vCloud Director. Thus this manual only describes tenant administration tasks that you can accomplish using the VMware Learning Platform's administrator user interface (Admin UI).
Describes how to create a deployment pool
Describes how to create a new lab and  how to create a catalog for the new lab
Describes how to create and edit user account(s)
Describes how to use the branding option to create a look/feel specific to the administrator’s organization (company or department)
Describes how to import instructional content (instructional manual for the lab)
Describes how to use the Event Management UI (for some basic event management tasks)

HOL-HBD-1686.Module Description: General high-level introduction to Continuent, topologies, and use cases.
This module will guide you through the key capabilities of Continuent with regards to MySQL Clustering and Failover, within one site and across multiple (two) geographic sites.

Continuent provides you the ability to configure Multi-Site “Active-Active” MySQL Clusters - this enables Client Applications to perform Write operations concurrently across two geographic sites.

This topology is referred to as “Multisite/Multimaster topology.

We will demonstrate Continuent’s ability to replicate from MySQL to Hadoop:
•	We’ll configure 1 MySQL Cluster on Site A and a Hadoop cluster on Site B.
•	Client will do write operations to the MySQL Cluster.
Subsequently, we’ll execute a Hadoop analytics job, where we’ll show the data written previously by Client is included in the analytics job.

HOL-MBL-1301.Module Title: Build and Operate the Mobile Secure Desktop
Build and Operate the Business Process Desktop
Build and Operate the Branch Office Desktop
Take a Guided Tour of VMware Horizon View

HOL-MBL-1309.Module Title: Mirage - Explore the New Web Admin Console

HOL-MBL-1451.Module Description: This module will guide you through an overview of Horizon View and many common and new features.

This module is designed to give you experience with the new feature of View Published Applications. Attendees can expect to gain knowledge in setup and configuration of a Microsoft RDS system for use with VMware Horizon View, installing applications, and publishing applications and end user experience.
n this module you will learn the advantages VMware Virtual SAN and how Horizon View can take advantage to drive down storage costs for desktop workloads
In this module you will learn the details on basic building blocks for a View pod and how to move and locate multiple View pods across datacenters and sites into a single Cloud pod.

This modules covers new performance features introduced in Horizon View 6 and will demonstrates Windows 7 desktop optimization along with guiding you through some of the new features including PCoIP tuning.
In this module we'll work through some of the common troubleshooting scenarios that new users of Horizon View often run in to, as well as some tips and tricks for managing a successful environment.
In this module you will learn how Horizon View leverages SSL Certificates and how to create, sign and install the necessary certificates.
HOL-MBL-1451.Module Title: SSL Certificates in Horizon 6 with View

HOL-MBL-1452.Module Description: Provide a secure workspace for your full-time staff and part-time contractors. Today's users demand access to corporate resources from multiple devices and operating systems, as well as the flexibility to work from home and remote offices. In this lab you will use VMware ThinApp to protect against application corruption and VMware vShield App to prevent unauthorized access between user desktops.
HOL-MBL-1452.Module Title: Build and Operate the Mobile Secure Workplace

HOL-MBL-1452.Module Description: Learn how VMware solutions add value to the business desktop through an improved End User Experience, Persona Management and Universal Communications. You will walk through the end user experience and then see the difference with a high quality PCoIP connection. Next, you will use Persona management to save personal updates and changes.
HOL-MBL-1452.Module Title: Build and Operate the Call Center Desktop

HOL-MBL-1452.Module Description: Learn how View simplifies the management and operational aspects within a branch office via fast, secure access to the applications and data.
HOL-MBL-1452.Module Title: Build and Operate the Branch Office Desktop

HOL-MBL-1452.Module Description: In this module you will review the components of vCenter Operations for View and see how this solution can enable IT administrators and help desk specialists to monitor and manage Horizon View Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) environments.
HOL-MBL-1452.Module Title: Take a Guided Tour of vCOPS for View

HOL-MBL-1452.Module Description: In this lab you will learn the benefits and how best to utilize the new application remoting capabilities of Horizon View 6.
HOL-MBL-1452.Module Title: Understanding use cases for Application Remoting

HOL-MBL-1452.Module Description: In this lab you will learn the design benefits and how best to utilize the new cloud pod architecture (CPA) capabilities of Horizon View 6.
HOL-MBL-1452.Module Title: Understanding use cases for Cloud Pod Architecture

HOL-MBL-1452.Module Description: In this module you will leverage the integration between View and Mirage to manage View static desktops.

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: This module will provide you with an introduction to VMware Workspace Portal.
This module will show you how to publish and allow end users access to Horizon 6 Published Applications.
HOL-MBL-1453.Module Title: Published Horizon 6 Applications in VMware Workspace Portal

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: This module will guide you through VMware Workspace Portal management such as reporting, user administration, policies and more.
HOL-MBL-1453.Module Title: A Day in the Life of VMware Workspace Portal

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: This module will teach you how to integrate Web applications into Workspace Portal. In this module we will add standard Web applications as well as configure SSO using SAML.
HOL-MBL-1453.Module Title: VMware Workspace Portal and Web/SaaS application

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: In this module we will show you how to manage Windows based applications on any Windows based client using VMware Workspace Portal and VMware ThinApp.
HOL-MBL-1453.Module Title: VMware Workspace Portal and ThinApp Integration

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: This module explains prerequisites and the process of deploying Workspace Portal. You will also setup an external database.
HOL-MBL-1453.Module Title: Install and configure VMware Workspace Portal using external database

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: This module will help you change the SSL certificate used by Workspace Portal and will teach you how to configure Kerberos Single-Sign On.
HOL-MBL-1453.Module Title: VMware Workspace Portal and SSL Certificates and Kerberos SSO

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: Describes and walk the student through how to deploy Workspace Portal in a High Availability setup.
HOL-MBL-1453.Module Title: How to deploy Workspace in a High Availability cluster

HOL-MBL-1453.Module Description: This module guides the student through the process of updating Workspace from 1.8.2 to version 2.1.

HOL-MBL-1455.Module Description: A Base Layer is a core component in a desktop image management solution using VMware Horizon Mirage. In this lesson, you will capture a base layer from a virtual machine that has been configured and considered the "gold master" for your organization.

In this lesson, we will explore the Application Layer functionality that allows the layering of applications for specific users, groups, or business units. Application layers allow IT to have flexibility in assigning applications to end users or groups of devices.
In this lesson we will go through several use cases of Mirage, including Win7 to Win8 migration, enforcement of base layer images, and recovering a lost or stolen laptop.

VMware Mirage 4.3 added the Mirage Gateway which is used to manage endpoints which are non VPN connected securely through a DMZ based gateway server. We will explore the functionality of this feature in this module.

VMware Mirage 4.2 added a new web console to align with other VMware products which are converging toward a common web-based interface. In this release, the Web Management Console is focused on providing basic administration capabilities for IT staff that do not require the full capabilities offered in the existing MMC snap-in console. The Web Management Console will be the primary interface for Help Desk staff addressing end-user questions and issues.

HOL-MBL-1456.Module Description: This module describes the concept of DaaS, how it differs from traditional VDI, and advantages/disadvantages of DaaS.
This module steps us through the process of configuring a new DaaS tenant, provisioning desktops, and connecting to the desktop.
Steps a user through day to operation and management of a DaaS environment including dashboard navigation, backing up desktops, making configuration changes, and changing users and roles.

HOL-MBL-1457.Module Description: This module will show enrollment of a device into AirWatch and the creation and installation of some basic profiles.
Module 2 builds on Module 1 adding AD integration, Certificate deployment, and additional profiles.
This module will focus on creating the environment for a single device/multi-user scenario.  This will build on Module 1 and Module 2, but are not a necessary pre-requirement.
In this module, the participant will log into the console and configure several mobile device applications to be downloaded to the device.
HOL-MBL-1457.Module Title: Application Management, Internal, Public, and VPP

HOL-MBL-1457.Module Description: The participant of this module will be configuring content to be available on the their mobile device.  Content types include Airwatch, SkyDrive, or Google Docs.
Participant will perform a broad mix of API calls to an enrolled device.
Participant will work through more advanced certificate navigation.  This builds on Module 2 where basic connection to Microsoft ADCS was setup.

HOL-MBL-1458.Module Description: This module will include a brief introduction and overview of App Volumes to educate the attendee on what App Volumes is and does.
Learn how an application stack is created, managed, and delivered with App Volumes.
This module will demonstrate the User Installed Applications synchronization feature and how this can benefit users who utilize multiple systems such as View/RDS desktops.

In this module, you will learn how App Volumes User Profile writeable volume allows for user data synchronization from desktop to desktop by making a change on one desktop, logging out, and then authenticating to another desktop and seeing that change replicated into the new system automatically without using Windows Roaming Profiles.
Learn how ThinApp Packaged applications can be quickly integrated into virtual desktops by use of App Volumes.

In this module, you can gain a quick understanding on how App Volumes technology works with RDSH, whether the user attaches to an RDS host via a remote desktop or just to an application. Here an attendee will get to attach existing applications to the host VM for all remote desktop users and then publish these applications through the View Connection Server Admin console, followed up with a testing of both scenarios.
Understand how App Volumes changes the game with Dynamic Desktop Delivery of applications.

HOL-MBL-1651.Module Description: Explore some of the latest and in-demand features of Horizon 6.
HOL-MBL-1651.Module Title: New and In-Demand Features of Horizon 6

HOL-MBL-1651.Module Description: Getting hands on with View Planner tool from scratch to getting an expert on VDI and RDSH sizing with View Planner and also finding consolidation ratio for bring your own apps (BYOA)
HOL-MBL-1651.Module Title: Sizing VDI and RDSH deployments using View Planner 3.5

HOL-MBL-1651.Module Description: Understand how to setup and configure a VDI Desktop pool for multiple users.

This modules covers performance features introduced in Horizon 6 and will demonstrate Windows desktop optimization along with guiding you through some of the features and topics, including PCoIP tuning.
In this module we'll work through some of the common troubleshooting scenarios that new users of Horizon 6 often run in to, as well as some tips and tricks for managing a successful environment.
In this module you will learn how Horizon 6 leverages SSL Certificates and how to create, sign and install the necessary certificates.

This module is designed to give you experience with the new feature of Horizon 6 Published Applications. Attendees can expect to gain knowledge in setup and configuration of a Microsoft RDS system for use with VMware Horizon 6, installing applications, and publishing applications and end user experience.

HOL-MBL-1651.Module Title: VMware App Volume Integration with Horizon 6

HOL-MBL-1651.Module Description: Configuring VMware User Environment Manager to work with Horizon 6 and provide a simpler way to quickly deploy unconfigured desktop images and have them configured on the fly.
HOL-MBL-1651.Module Title: VMware User Environment Manager Integration with Horizon 6

HOL-MBL-1651.Module Description: Creating and Configuring a Linux Hosted Desktop to work with Horizon 6 and demo the presentation of it to the end user.
HOL-MBL-1651.Module Title: Presenting a Linux Hosted Desktop with Horizon 6

HOL-MBL-1652.Module Title: A Day in the Life of VMW EUC
Cloud Pod Architecture Intro and Use Cases
Mirage Rapid Desktop Repair and Disaster Recovery
Introduction to VMware User Environment Manager
Dynamically Managing Desktop Settings within the User Environment

HOL-MBL-1653.Module Description: This module will cover the install and configure of VMware Workspace Portal. It will teach you how to configure certificates and how to setup Workspace Portal using an external database.
In this module you will learn how to setup Horizon Workspace Portal as front end for Horizon View and provide Single Sign On/SAML authentication.

In this module you will learn how to configure a ThinApp repository in the VMware Workspace Portal and entitle users/user groups to access applications. You will learn how to handle software updates for ThinApp packages presented via the VMware Workspace Portal
We will also show (video) how to integrate an existing XenApp environment into the VMware Workspace Portal to allow for a seamless user experience.

In this module you will learn how to configure Web and SaaS applications in Workspace Portal. With Workspace Portal you can provide Single-Sign On (SSO) for your users to SAML and WS-Fed enabled Web applications.

In this module we will show you how to integrate VMware Workspace Portal with AirWatch. As this integration requires internet access - which unfortunately is not available in this lab environment - we will walk you through the necessary steps by showing a video of the integration.

This module will teach you how to configure Workspace Portal using an external Microsoft SQL database. Support for MS SQL is a new feature in this version of Workspace Portal. You will also learn how to setup Workspace Portal for high availability (HA).
HOL-MBL-1653.Module Title: Configure Workspace using Microsoft SQL 2014 and RADIUS

HOL-MBL-1654.Module Description: This module will guide you through an overview of Horizon 6 application delivery and integration.
HOL-MBL-1654.Module Title: Delivery and integration of Applications with Horizon VDI/RDSH

HOL-MBL-1654.Module Description: This module will walk through capturing and deploying a Mirage app layer.
HOL-MBL-1654.Module Title: Managing Applications with Mirage Application Layers

HOL-MBL-1654.Module Description: In this module you will first walk through the process of creating an application pool, and entitling the pool to an end-user. The second part of the module will focus on the end-user experience of accessing the application.
HOL-MBL-1654.Module Title: Hosted applications with Horizon 6 Remote App

HOL-MBL-1654.Module Description: This module will give a ThinApp overview and walk through the capture process.

This module demonstrates how to enable ThinApp packages for easier deployment and entitlement using VMware Workspace Portal. Workspace can be used to help deploy ThinApp packages to your end-users. It also helps in protecting your ThinApp packages. Once Workspace management has been enabled on a ThinApp package you cannot launch the package without a valid entitlement from Workspace Portal.
In this module you will gain an understanding of the existing application delivery and management pain points experienced by environments today.
In this module, you will walk through the Application Lifecycle and Delivery methodology as it relates to App Volumes.

VMware App Volumes allows provisioning and assignment of Writable Volumes for users and desktops. Users then have the ability to install and configure their own applications. This feature is called User Installed Applications (UIA).
In this module you will learn how VMware App Volumes supports User Installed Applications (UIA) and supports access to this applications across multiple desktops and desktop types.
HOL-MBL-1654.Module Title: User Installed Applications with App Volumes

HOL-MBL-1654.Module Description: In this module you will gain an understanding of how App Volumes works with RDSH.
HOL-MBL-1654.Module Title: App Volumes Deployment with Remote Desktop Hosted Applications

HOL-MBL-1654.Module Description: This module will cover updating applications delivered with App Volumes.

HOL-MBL-1655.Module Description: In this Module, you will learn what VMware Horizon FLEX is, what the basic Administrator work flow is regarding Horizon FLEX, the Administrative functions within the Horizon FLEX Policy Server (Manager) are, what the basic User work flow is, and most importantly what use cases can be addressed with the use of Horizon FLEX.
In this module, you will learn how VMware Horizon FLEX can work with Mobile Users and Remotely Managed Desktops.
HOL-MBL-1655.Module Title: Mobile Users and Remotely Managed Desktops with BYO

HOL-MBL-1655.Module Description: In this module, you will learn how to how VMware Horizon FLEX can work with Mobile Users and Remotely Managed Desktops.

In this module, you will gain a technical understanding of building a VMware Horizon FLEX VM image for deployment, walk through the configuration of Horizon FLEX Policies and Entitlements, and deploy a virtual machine from the image.
HOL-MBL-1655.Module Title: Building a Custom Horizon FLEX VM

HOL-MBL-1656.Module Description: This chapter will provide a brief introduction to the concept of Horizon Air, which is a Desktop as a Service (DaaS) solution, and why demand is so high. Please review the following pages. They will help you understand the rationale and value behind the Horizon Air solution and the configurations you will explore during this lab.

This module covers the process of setting up a Horizon Air tenant,  and creating pools for both desktops and hosted applications.  You will review images (patterns) for both desktops and RDSH based hosted applications and provision a desktop and an application pool.   Finally you will entitle users allowing them to access the pools that have been provisioned.

In this module you will learn how to manage the Horizon Air environment.  You will learn how to manage images for both desktops and hosted applications, monitor system health, how to connect into desktops and applications and management of user sessions.
HOL-MBL-1656.Module Title: Management of Desktops and Hosted Applications

HOL-MBL-1657.Module Description: This module is designed to give you an introduction to AirWatch and Mobile Device Management.   In this module you will do basic setup and configuration in the AirWatch Console and you will enroll a mobile device and see how AirWatch can manage the it by using profiles.

This module is designed to give show you how the AirWatch Tunnel integrates with NSX to enhance network security.   In this module you will configure a device application to use Per App VPN with an AirWatch Tunnel Server that is integrated with NSX.
HOL-MBL-1657.Module Title: VMware NSX and AirWatch Tunnel Integration

HOL-MBL-1657.Module Description: This module is designed to show you the basic functions and features of managing an Apple OS X computer.  In this module you will configure AirWatch to manage an OS X device, creating profiles and other configurations.   You will also enroll an OS X computer to see how these profiles and configurations work on the device.
HOL-MBL-1657.Module Title: Basic Apple Mac OS X Management

HOL-MBL-1657.Module Description: This module is designed to give you an in depth look at features available in AirWatch for managing an Apple iOS device.   In this module you will configure profiles and other configurations specifically for iOS devices.   You will also enroll an iOS device to see how these profiles and configurations work on the device.

This module is designed to give you an introduction into "Branding" the AirWatch Console, Self Service Portal and the Secure Content Locker.   The term "Branding" means that the look and feel of the interface is changed to match a brand such as color scheme, logos and more.   In this lab you will brand the Management Console, the Self Service Portal (SSP) and the Secure Content Locker (SCL).
HOL-MBL-1657.Module Title: Branding the AirWatch Console, SSP and SCL

HOL-MBL-1657.Module Description: This module is designed to give you an introduction into administrator roles and user roles.   In this module you will configure multiple administrator roles and see what affect each setting has on the administrator's access to Management Console functions and features.   In addition, you will configure user roles and see how this affects what a user can and can't do in the Self Service Portal.

HOL-MBL-1658.Module Description: This module is designed to give you an in depth look into how AirWatch integrates with Active Directory and Microsoft's Certificate Authority using the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC).   In this module you will install ACC in an Active Directory Domain, enroll with a user that is a member of the domain and push a certificate that is generated by the local certificate authority.
HOL-MBL-1658.Module Title: Advanced MDM with AD Integration and Certificates

HOL-MBL-1658.Module Description: This module is designed to give you a basic introduction to the single device/multiple user use case.   In this lab you will setup AirWatch to support this use case, enroll a device with a staging user and check the device out with a basic user.

This module is designed to give you an introduction to the AirWatch REST API interface.   In this module you will learn about AirWatch's robust set of API calls, learn how to enable the API and make actual REST calls using basic browser tools.

This module is designed to give you an introduction in the ACE which is a new standard of integration between device applications and AirWatch.   In the module you will configure key value pairs in the AirWatch Management Console and see how these values are used in a sample device application.

This module is designed to give you an introduction into using the AirWatch Tunnel Server and Per App VPN.   In this module you will setup and configure a device application for Per App VPN which will then connect to an existing AirWatch Tunnel server.
HOL-MBL-1658.Module Title: Using the AirWatch Tunnel and Per App VPN

HOL-MBL-1658.Module Description: This module is designed to give you an introduction into the AirWatch and VMware Horizon integration.   In this module you will enroll a device into an environment which already has the integration configured so that you can easily see the integration of one app, any device.

This module is designed to show you how to setup and configure a content repository in the AirWatch console.   In this module you will configure a content repository in the AirWatch Management Console, enroll a device and view the content from the repository on the device.

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Description:
Today’s ongoing technology transition to a “mobility first” environment is making a profound impact on how organizations operate. With mobile devices and applications often taking center stage, the evolution opens up a world of interesting opportunities, but also puts a strain on IT to cost-effectively provide secure environments that encourage rather than hamper productivity. Together, F5 with VMware provides enhanced security, greater access control, architectural simplicy and efficiency while delivering high performance, high availability, and a more productive environment for your business.
In this module, we'll provide an overview of F5 and VMware End User Computing solution integration.
HOL-MBL-1659.Module Title: Intelligent Availability and Traffic Management with F5 BIG-IP

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Description:
F5's BIG-IP Virtual Edition can rapidly provision software-defined application services across the data center and into the cloud – with the same experience, advanced application services, and breadth of features as F5’s leading hardware systems.
In this module, we'll walk through the deployment and initial configuration of the BIG-IP Virtual Edition.
HOL-MBL-1659.Module Title: F5 BIG-IP Virtual Edition Deployment with vSphere

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Description:
After the BIG-IP Virtual Edition appliance is deployed and can be accessed using the management IP address, the next step is to complete the basic configuration. In this module, we'll complete the basic setup and configuration of the F5 BIG-IP Virtual Edition.
Here's a high-level of what will be completed during the setup:
•	Feature/Functionality Licensing
•	Feature Modules - Enabling/Disabling and Resource Management 
•	Installing Device Certificate (Optional)
•	Configuration of Self IP Addresses
•	Configuration of VLANs and Network Interfaces
•	Assigning Console and Web UI administrator passwords
HOL-MBL-1659.Module Title: Basic Setup and Configuration of the F5 BIG-IP Virtual Edition

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Description:
In this module, we'll perform additional administrative and configuration functions related to iApps and Certificates.
Here's a high-level of what will be completed during the setup:
•	Upload iApp template to BIG-IP
•	Upload PFX Certificate and Root CA Certificate to BIG-IP

In this module, we'll configure the BIG-IP to load balance authentication and authorization connections across a pool of Horizon Connection Servers.
Here's a high-level of what will be completed during the setup:
•	Configure the iApp for View to support load balancing Horizon Clients across a pool of Connection Servers
•	Test and validate the Horizon Client connections.
•	Test the failure of one server in the pool
HOL-MBL-1659.Module Title: Load Balancing Connection Servers for Horizon Client Access

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Description: In this module you will learn how to load balance Horizon Security Servers.
HOL-MBL-1659.Module Title: Load Balancing Security Servers for Horizon Client Access

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Description: In this module you will learn how to configure the F5 as a PCoIP Proxy/Security Server alternative.
HOL-MBL-1659.Module Title: Implementing PCoIP Proxy as a Security Server Alternative

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Description: In this lab we will provide external access and load balance the Workspace Portal.

HOL-MBL-1659.Module Title: Managing Horizon Traffic across Multiple Data Centers with BIG-IP

HOL-PRT-1301.Module Description: Day-to-Day storage management using the VMware vSphere Web Client plugin from NetApp
HOL-PRT-1301.Module Title: NetApp Storage Console for vSphere Web Client

HOL-PRT-1302.Module Description: Use Tivoli Storage Manager to provide scheduled protection and simplified recovery of mission-critical data
HOL-PRT-1302.Module Title: Simplified data protection for virtual machines with Tivoli Storage Manager

HOL-PRT-1303.Module Description: This module provides experience with ViPR software defined storage, Puppet automation for EMC Avamar and Hyperic monitoring integration with the EMC Avamar backup product
HOL-PRT-1303.Module Title: Using Puppet, Hyperic, and the vSphere Web Client to provide automation and visibility into EMC Information Infrastructure

HOL-PRT-1304.Module Description: This module demonstrates the steps needed to configure vCAC and the Infoblox appliance to achieve IP automated address provisioning of virtual machines

HOL-PRT-1461.Module Description: In this lab exercise you will explore ViPR features and capabilities.

In this lab you will create the ViPR VASA Provider to enable VMware vCenter access to ViPR-managed storage infrastructure - Virtual Storage Pools (VSP’s).  Then you will create a new Virtual Machine using exported ViPR VASA provider storage capabilities, place the new Virtual Machine on the Datastore you have created in previous lab using ViPR Self-service portal, and expand the Datastore using one of the ViPR workflows in the vCenter Orchestrator (VCO).
In this exercise you will review the ViPR Monitoring and Reporting of historical reports on capacity, utilization and performance of the storage infrastructure managed by ViPR

In this lab you will review how the developers of the BigData applications, such as Hadoop, can use ViPR Data Services capabilities to access the unstructured data stored on legacy block and file storage systems using ViPR Object HDFS capabilities.
HOL-PRT-1461.Module Title: ViPR Support for Hadoop and HDFS

HOL-PRT-1462.Module Description: This module provides an overview of the Palo Alto Networks VM-Series integration with VMware NSX and the configuration of dynamic security policies based on context from VMware NSX. When finished with module one, attendees will have learned:  How to synchronize VMware NSX with Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewall security policy; How Palo Alto Networks VM-Series automatically maintains state with a VMware virtualized data center; How to create Dynamic Address Groups, link them to NSX Security Groups and create security policies that protect east-west, VM to VM traffic.
HOL-PRT-1462.Module Title: Creating Dynamic Next-generation Policy for Securing a Virtualized Data Center

HOL-PRT-1462.Module Description: In this module, the VMware NSX and Palo Alto Networks VM-Series solution will be deployed to secure web server to database server applications. When finished with this module, attendees will have learned: How to create NSX Security Groups with dynamic membership using VM security tags; How to use Security Groups to create steering policies that will direct relevant traffic to the Palo Alto Networks virtual firewall for policy enforcement and inspection; How to configure the VM-Series to securely manage traffic and maintain state with the VMware virtualized data center.
HOL-PRT-1462.Module Title: Integrating Palo Alto Networks Next-generation firewalls with NSX

Puppet Enterprise enables IT teams to automate VM lifecycle management and scale services quickly, reliably, and efficiently. In this lab you will walk through using services defined by Puppet modules in conjunction with vCAC blueprints, to deploy a multi-tier application managed by Puppet.

HOL-PRT-1472.Module Description: Juniper Junos Space is a solution that simplifies and automates management of Juniper's network devices. Components work together to deliver a unified network management and orchestration solution that enables more efficient network, security, and virtualization management. In this module we will quickly cover the specifics of the product and how it fits into your virtualized environment.

Using the Juniper plug-n-play applications; Security Director and Virtual Director, you are able to get a complete physical and virtual view of your network and security infrastructure. The simplicity and easy of the Security Director provides security policy management through extensive security scale, granular policy control, and policy breadth across the network. Virtual Director is a full lifecycle management application for Firefly Perimeter that enables organizations to automate provisioning and resource allocation. In this module we will experience both applications as well as Firefly Perimeter.
HOL-PRT-1472.Module Title: Managing Your Physical and Virtual Infrastructure with Juniper Junos Space

HOL-PRT-1472.Module Description: Juniper DDoS Secure uses a heuristic and granular approach to mitigating DDoS attacks. DDoS Secure uses its patented CHARM algorithm to learn which IP addresses can be trusted and is able to respond intelligently and in real time by dropping suspect or noncompliant packets as soon as the optimum performance from critical resources begins to degrade. In this lab we will walk you through a Volumetric DDoS attack and a Low and Slow DDoS attack, how Juniper DDoS Secure protects your virtual applications during these attacks, and show you how DDoS Secure protects your physical and virtual environment.

HOL-PRT-1671.Module Title: Tenant User Backup and File Level Restore

This module also shows you how to define dynamic security policies on Panorama based on context from VMware NSX.

HOL-PRT-1672.Module Title: Using advanced Palo Alto Networks security policy to protect application tiers

HOL-SDC-1407.Module Description: This module will introduce you to VMware vSphere PowerCLI. Novice users will easily learn to use the tool and more advanced users will get familiar with the new functionality available in the latest releases of the product like extended vSphere tags and VDS management. Both new and expert users are sure to learn something new.
HOL-SDC-1407.Module Title: From Beginner to the Latest Features with PowerCLI

HOL-SDC-1407.Module Description: This module will introduce you to the new VMware vSphere PowerCLI cmdlets for VSAN. We will demonstrate how to perform common VSAN related automation and reporting tasks with PowerCLI.

Users will start with out of the box workflows and alter them slightly by linking in other workflows to create a situation that allows an administrator to remove vCenter snapshots on running VMs, create a report of tasks completed, then send the report to the admin via email.
Users will learn how to alter vCO workflows to do advanced actions like creating loops to allow admins to complete more work with one click.
HOL-SDC-1407.Module Title: Customizing vCO Workflows for Advanced Automation

HOL-SDC-1407.Module Description: In this lab, we will demonstrate the steps required to implement Auto Deploy to support stateless ESXi hosts for upgrading hosts or rapidly deploying new hosts. This lab will take you through the process of preparing the PXE boot infrastructure, configuring the Auto Deploy server, preparing the Host Profile, and how to use PowerCLI to import software bundles and create Image Profiles and deploy rules. Upon completion of this module we will deploy a new ESXi host into an existing HA cluster.
HOL-SDC-1407.Module Title: Automating vSphere Hosts Deployments with vSphere Auto Deploy

HOL-SDC-1408.Module Description: This module will give an overview and requirements of vSAN, then walk the participant through setup and enabling the vSAN components and finally walk them through how to build storage policies.
This module will show the interaction between core vSphere features with vSAN, like vMotion, HA, and Storage vMotion.  The participant will also be given an overview of related PowerCLI commands.
HOL-SDC-1408.Module Title: Virtual SAN with vMotion, Storage vMotion and HA Interoperability

HOL-SDC-1408.Module Description: This use-case module will walk the participant through how they would typically have to assign storage polices and how vSAN will help them. It will show them how to change the policies on the fly as their workload changes.
This module will give an overview of administering Virtual SAN via the Command Line.

HOL-SDC-1410.Module Description: This module will guide the participant through the basic storage features included with vSphere and vCenter. It will also highlight what other labs the participant can take to receive more information on more advanced topics.

HOL-SDC-1411.Module Description: This module covers the process of working with vRealize Business Standard as it relates to solving the problem around the inability to make meaningful decisions based on real-time reporting.

This module covers the process of working with the out-of-the-box financial cost model within vRealize Business Advanced to drive intelligent dashboards. Key concepts will be presented via hands-on activities demonstrating financial management and interaction with actionable dashboards and reporting. You will review and modify an IT cost model comprised of traditional IT infrastructure components and associated spend. You will then review the output of this activity in Out of the Box dashboards and reports: demonstrating how VMware vRealize Business enables an organization to manage IT infrastructure as a business. You will learn how to simplify and automate the business and financial aspects of your entire IT Service Portfolio. You will utilize cost models and CIO dashboards to gain cost visibility and provide cost transparency; Utilize what-if scenarios to identify ways to optimize IT Service costs; and Produce a Bill of IT to report IT Service costs and consumption via showback and/or chargeback.

This module covers the ability to understand quality of service alongside the financial cost.  Bring in SLA metrics and components to the decision making process while maintaining holistic view of IT from infrastructure, platform, to hybrid including the vendors used. Develop controls around managing vendor performance and service quality levels.

HOL-SDC-1430.Module Description: OMG, please don’t tell me we’re going to kick things off with a stupid Hello World app?!  Yep.  But don’t worry, it will be short and fun.  And necessary for the rest of the lab.  Just bare with us.

OK, it’s time to feel the pain.  Sorry, we apologize in advance.  But in order to really understand DevOps, we need a before and after picture.  So embrace your inner fat guy (or gal), put on your super tight speedos and say cheese!
We’ve reached the point to dig into Docker a little bit.  Docker has become a powerful force in the DevOps word, and for good reason.  It’s time to find out why.

However awesome Docker is (and it really is awesome), it isn’t a complete solution in and of itself, especially in the Enterprise.  Let’s now explore the many ways Docker can be delivered to developers leveraging VMware technologies.
We’ve arrived at our “after” shot!  Put on your best bikini, flex your six-pack and say “DevOps!”

HOL-SDC-1601.Module Description: vRealize Operations Manager provides administrators with simple and powerful information they need to make sure virtual machines have the optimal amount of resources allocated.  A virtual machine may have been provisioned with far more resources than are required to support an application.  This leads to waste and inefficiencies that drive up costs and create artificial constraints on an otherwise well designed virtual infrastructure. On the other hand, virtual machines can also be unintentionally starved for resources due to under-sized allocation of resources.  In a highly efficient virtual infrastructure it is important to identify and correct these imbalances and tune virtual machine allocations to the level appropriate for each individual application. Fortunately, vRealize Operations Manager provides views and reports to help identify these imbalances and even makes recommendations on appropriate resource allocation.  This is known as Right-Sizing and this module will show you how.
HOL-SDC-1601.Module Title: Capacity Planning and Workload Placement with vRealize Operations

HOL-SDC-1603.Module Description: We will demonstrate how to create a Logical Switch and then attach two VM's to the Logical Switch that you created. Then demonstrate how the logical switch can span across L3 Physical Networks, and still have L2 connectivity between the two Web Servers.
This module is a quick overview of the NSX components and terminology.

In the NSX platform the distributed logical router allows you to route traffic between logical switches. One of the key differentiating feature of this logical router is that the routing capability is distributed in the hypervisor.  This module will have you set up Distributed Routing and Dynamic Routing Protocols.  ECMP is a routing strategy where next-hop packet forwarding to a single destination can occur over multiple best paths. Enabling ECMP substantially increases bandwidth by distributing traffic over multiple paths. In case of a path failure, traffic is distributed across the remaining links. This module will demonstrate ECMP with NSX.

One component of NSX is a distributed firewall kernel module. The distributed firewall is installed in each vSphere host to enable the functionality.  It is also user-identity aware and provides unique activity monitoring tools.  SpoofGuard allows you to authorize the IP addresses reported by VMware Tools, and alter them if necessary to prevent spoofing.  This module will explore NSX Security.

The NSX Edge Services Gateway provides network and security services to the virtual environment.  In many scenarios this is the boundary between the physical and virtual datacenters.  In this module you will see explore DHCP and Load Balancing services.

NSX provides the access point for network and security partners to insert their 3-party services.  Service Composer helps you provision and assign network and security services to applications in a virtual infrastructure. You map these services to a security group, and the services are applied to the virtual machines in the security group.  This module will explore creating security policies combining Service Composer and Data Security.
This module explores the native methods provided to monitor and trace packets in the virtual data center.  It will cover the monitoring of user access to the virtual data center.

An administrator will walk through creating and publishing application blueprints followed by a consumer requesting a deployment from the Self-Service Catalog.
HOL-SDC-1621.Module Title: Journey to private cloud, Deliver Applications and Middleware

HOL-SDC-1621.Module Description: This module will demonstrate how to use vRealize Code Stream to enable customers to integrate and orchestrate the DevOps release process by leveraging existing software development lifecycle tools. A developer or release manager will walk through the process to leverage Code Stream and vRealize Automation to provide continuous delivery by automating the tasks required to build, deploy, and test at each stage in the application release delivery pipeline.
HOL-SDC-1621.Module Title: Journey to private cloud, Deliver on DevOps

HOL-SDC-1621.Module Description: This module will walk through the creation of reservations used to create and publish consumable catalog items. This includes a review of the multi-platform support options available out of the box with vRealize Automation.
HOL-SDC-1621.Module Title: Journey to private cloud, Governance and Security

HOL-SDC-1621.Module Description: This module will demonstrate the ability to use vRealize Business Standard with vRealize Automation to provide accurate cost transparency to consumers and IT management for your virtual infrastructure.

HOL-SDC-1622.Module Description: You will learn how to write Python scripts to navigate and operate on a virtual datacenter using pyvmomi (the Python SDK for vSphere API) and the vCloud Suite SDK. You will also learn how to use the Python interpreter and graphical debugger. There are many samples for you to work with that cover a wide variety of datacenter automation use cases, including the latest vSphere 6.0 features.
You will learn how to write Python scripts to run vRealize Orchestrator Workflows via the REST API.
HOL-SDC-1622.Module Title: Python Scripting vRealize Orchestrator Workflows with the REST API

HOL-SDC-1622.Module Description: This module illustrates Python scripting of new features introduced in vSphere 6.0 (Content Catalog) and existing features which did not have a public API prior to the vSphere 6.0 release (Tagging). This module also demonstrates a provider, defining, implementing, and exposing new API services (API extensibility), and how to interoperate with other vSphere APIs.
HOL-SDC-1622.Module Title: Module 2 - Python scripting with the vCloud Suite SDK for Python

HOL-SDC-1622.Module Description: You will learn how to build Java applications to navigate and operate on a virtual datacenter using Workbench IS, the vSphere Management SDK, and the vCloud Suite SDK. You will also learn how to use the graphical debugger to step through code. There are many samples for you to work with that cover a wide variety of datacenter automation use cases, including the latest vSphere 6.0 features.
This module is an introduction to tools included in Workbench IS including: RSE (Remote System Explorer) - A tool  to inspect and manage resources on a remote ESXi or vCenter system.

This module illustrates programmatic access to new features introduced in vSphere 6.0 (Content Catalog) and existing features which did not have a public API prior to the vSphere 6.0 release (Tagging). This module also demonstrates a provider, defining, implementing, and exposing new API services (API extensibility), and how to interoperate with other vSphere APIs.
HOL-SDC-1622.Module Title: Module 5 - Workbench IS and the vCloud Suite SDK for Java

HOL-SDC-1624.Module Title: Creating an NSX Integrated Multi-Machine Blueprint in vRealize Automation
Understanding the NSX Management Pack for vRealize Operations
Understanding the NSX Content Pack for vRealize Log Insight
Use vRealize Advanced Service Designer to Create NSX Components and Services

HOL-SDC-1625.Module Description: NSX 6.2 now provides support for cross vCenter Servers management.  This module will cover the new fundamental components used in cross vCenter Networking.  This covers both switching and routing and the topic of local egress.
As NSX 6.2 provides support for cross vCenter Security.  In this module the topic of universal IP-sets, and security groups will be explored.
NSX 6.2 cross vCenter design requires considerations for routing and migration.

NSX provides in-kernel capabilities to bridge traditional VLAN to Logical Switches: this module will cover how NSX-V 6.2 allows a Logical Switch to be connected to a Distributed Logical Router and bridged to VLAN at the same time.

NSX L2VPN allows the extension of networks (both VLANs or Logical Switches) across different sites, even when NSX is deployed only on a single site or management domains are different. This module will guide you through the L2VPN configuration process.
NSX 6.2 has made day to day operations simpler by allowing for the requesting of data and setting configurations to multiple virtual appliances via a single console.
NSX Edge Services Gateway offers L2 VPN and point-to-point IPSec VPNs.  This module will explore the differences and configuration of each.
NXS 6.2 allows for open access for automated configuration via the RESTful API.  This module looks at how easy it is to automate the making, changing of network objects.

HOL-SDC-1627.Module Description: Learn how to leverage Storage Policies to match workload requirements with storage performance capabilities & features.  Use Storage Polices with VSAN and vVOL-based storage and explore how to migrate VMs to achieve or maintain policy compliance.

VMware's Virtual SAN (VSAN) is a showcase for the benefits of Software Defined Storage - including ease-of-configuration, ease-of-use and rich feature set.  Explore VSAN's configuration & health dashboards and learn how to create, customize and assign storage polices for VSAN-based VMs.

Learn about VMware's Software Defined Storage architecture including Virtual Volumes (VVOLs).  Experience how VASA 2.0 enables VMware's storage partners - Dell & EMC showcased in this lab - to offer storage capacity directly to vSphere w/o requiring LUNs or NFS.  Create VVOLs, explore storage capabilities and create/manage storage policies on these VVOLs.

Explore how solution providers can leverage "IO Filters" to safely and securely filter the disk IO stream for a given VM in accordance with a policy.  VAIO offers partners the ability to put their technology directly into the IO stream of a VM through a filter that intercepts data before it is committed to disk.
Explore the interoperability of VMware's vSphere Data Protection (vDP) backup & recovery solution with VVOLs and learn how to maintain storage policies when recovering VMs.

HOL-SDC-1627.Module Title: Automation of Software Defined Storage with SBPM and PowerCLI

HOL-SDC-1628.Module Description: EVO:RAIL is VMware's premier solution for Converged Infrastructure.  Learn how simple & quick it can be to deploy vSphere environments using EVO:RAIL.  Explore the configuration, management & scale-out of the EVO:RAIL platform.

HOL-SDC-1631.Module Description: This module will introduce the vSphere Optimization Assessment program (VOA) to a partner systems engineer and provide an overview of how it can be used as a pre-sales approach to help customer's understand more about their vSphere environment and how vRealize Operations can deliver value.
HOL-SDC-1631.Module Title: Introduction to the vSphere Optimization Assessment

HOL-SDC-1631.Module Description: This module will walk the attendee through the process of deploying vRealize Operations in the customer's environment.  Appliance deployment will be done as well as post-deployment configuration and tuning.
HOL-SDC-1631.Module Title: Beginning a VOA - Installing vRealize Operations

HOL-SDC-1631.Module Description: This module will walk the attendee through the process of using vRealize Operations to generate reports about the configuration state, performance and capacity of the customer's vSphere environment.
This module will explain how vRealize Operations is priced and packaged and how a customer can add it to their environment.

HOL-SDC-1632.Module Description: In this module, you will walk through the end-to-end deployment of a catalog item that has integrations into a number of third party systems.

Learn how to implement two of the most common use cases delivered by VMware PSO - custom hostnaming and DNS registration for your Linux workloads. You'll learn how to break down a naming convention and use properties from endpoints, business groups and blueprints to ensure that your workloads are named according to your policies.

Explore the out-of-the box integrations which vRealize Automation has with other VMware Cloud Management Platform products, including vRealize Business Standard, vRealize Operations Manager and vRealize Log Insight.
HOL-SDC-1632.Module Title: Integrating vRealize Automation with the VMware Cloud Management Platform

HOL-SDC-1632.Module Description: As you scale your cloud deployment, the need for a scalable and highly available DDI (DNS, DHCP, IPAM) solution becomes critical to automating the process of provisioning/deprovisiong VMs as they are created/destroyed. This module covers the use of the Infoblox IPAM plugin for vRealize Orchestrator as part of the vRealize Automation provisioning process.
HOL-SDC-1632.Module Title: Integrating vRealize Automation with Infoblox IPAM

HOL-SDC-1632.Module Description: In this module you will explore how your workloads can automatically register with a Puppet Master during the provisioning process, and automatically pull down manifests and modules.
HOL-SDC-1632.Module Title: Integrating vRealize Automation with Puppet Enterprise

HOL-SDC-1632.Module Description: See how vRealize Automation harnesses the power of NSX to provide automated network functions such as dynamic routing and load balancing. You'll also learn how to use policy based security to implement strong controls during workload provisioning.

Investigate how the Advanced Services Designer allows you to expose the power of vRealize Orchestrator to your users - with none of the risk. In this module, you will create a Catalog Item from an Orchestrator workflow, as well as  a Day Two action that can be assigned to your workloads.
HOL-SDC-1632.Module Title: XaaS Services with Advanced Service Designer and vRealize Orchestrator

HOL-SDC-1632.Module Description: Mastered vRealize Orchestrator? Great! Now that you know how northbound integration is delivered, you'll take a look at southbound integration options with the vRealize Automation API. You'll use a REST client, the VMware Cloud Client and maybe even a bit of Python to perform some basic tasks to get you started working with the vRealize Automation API.
HOL-SDC-1632.Module Title: Working with the vRealize Automation API

HOL-SDC-1607.Module Description: This module covers basic Power CLI for vSphere, plus some new features in the following lessons: 1) Using PowerCLI for reporting 2) Setting up and configuring a cluster 3) Setting up and configuring a distributed switch 4) Working with tags 5) Configuring and deploying an OVF template
HOL-SDC-1607.Module Title: From Beginner to Advanced Features with PowerCLI
